Description: Five beads of different shape and material and a fragment of an amulet. A: Floral cone-bead made of turquoise faience, relatively long. B: Three disc-shaped beads made of ostrich eggshell. One slightly smaller than the other two. C: One flattened sphere bead made of white faience. D: Small fragment of an amulet, made of a pinkish glazed stone (?), only the lug and a small part of the actual amulet are preserved, difficult to define, maybe part of a floral element or head with hair? The perforation is askew and very thin at the rear.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
